documents.title: Configuration
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive instructions and reference tables for configuring the YASB status bar using YAML files and environment variables.

documents.title: FAQ
documents.summary: This document provides troubleshooting steps and answers to common questions regarding the installation, configuration, styling, and performance of the YASB status bar.

documents.title: Installation
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for installing YASB on Windows through various methods including manual installers, package managers, and source code builds.

documents.title: Writing Widget
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive step-by-step guide for developers to create, configure, and validate custom widgets using Python, Pydantic, and the Qt framework.

documents.title: CLI
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive overview of the YASB command line interface, detailing commands and options for managing status bar operations, visibility, and system configuration.

documents.title: Contributing
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for developers wishing to contribute to the YASB project, detailing environment setup, development workflows, and coding standards. It covers essential tools like Ruff and pre-commit to ensure code quality across the codebase.

documents.title: Home
documents.summary: This document serves as the central landing page for the YASB wiki, providing a navigational overview of installation, configuration, styling, and contribution resources for the Windows status bar application.

documents.title: Keybindings
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and use global keyboard shortcuts to trigger widget actions in YASB, covering supported keys, modifier matching, and system limitations.

documents.title: Styling
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive instructions on how to customize the appearance of YASB using CSS for elements like bars, widgets, and menus, as well as YAML for shadow configurations.
